bug.summary: Web demo: Bug when labeling with radio buttons
bug.description:
From <denchmark-link:https://github.com/SyRenity>@SyRenity</denchmark-link> in <denchmark-link:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/cmu-openface/BakNUG5Lr1w>this</denchmark-link> mailing list thread: <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Install the latest docker version: docker pull bamos/openface
Launch the docker as bash (regular launch didn't work for me, complaining it can't find th): docker run -t -i -p 8000:8000 -p 9000:9000 bamos/openface /bin/bash
Click train to start training
Stop training after 7-10 images
Add a name
Click in trained faces list on the added name radio button to assign name to face
Demo crashes with: 2016-01-21 20:51:46+0000 [-] /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sklearn/cross_validation.py:417: exceptions.Warning: The least populated class in y has only 1 members, which is too few. The minimum number of labels for any class cannot be less than n_folds=5. 2016-01-21 20:51:46+0000 [OpenFaceServerProtocol,0,192.168.253.221] Unhandled Error
exceptions.ValueError: The number of classes has to be greater than one; got 1
By the way, if I follow the demo youtube video usage flow (first creating a name then training), it works fine.

comments.comment: I'm also facing the same issue .... Any hints on how to solve ?
I got this problem as well

Hello , This is because SVM by default is multiclase and as the error says you are trying to train only one class. See official documentation. <denchmark-link:http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.svm.SVC.html>http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.svm.SVC.html</denchmark-link>
In a nutshell you try to train a model with only one person. If for some reason, so you need, I can think of a dirty trick. Creates 2 folders one with data of the person to identify and another with data that you will call unknown. I apologize for my English, I do not speak it natively.
